Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has been watered, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that has not been watered, showing it as wilted or not growing.
The student can identify and illustrate that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can use observations to show how the appearance of a plant changes with and without water.
The student can depict the sunlight's role by drawing plants exposed to light.
The student can illustrate the effects of light absence by drawing plants in a dark or shaded area.
